definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The Folk Songs of Northern Shaanxi is the most representative artistic form ofthe Loess Culture.
sentences.chinese: 陝北民歌是黃土文化中最具代表性的藝術形式。

sentences.english: Using this function, we can get more representational eigenvector from email.
sentences.chinese: 利用此函數可提取到更具有代表性的郵件特徵向量。

sentences.english: A typical example is the oxidation of ethylbenzene to prepare acetophenone.
sentences.chinese: 其中最有代表性的是乙苯氧化制苯乙酮。

sentences.english: Blue Allover is the most representative daily article and decorating article in the area South of Yangtze River.
sentences.chinese: 藍印花布是江南最有代表性的生活用品和裝飾用品。

sentences.english: Li Xian-qiao was a representative writer of GaoMi Poetic School in Qin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 李憲喬是清代高密詩派的代表性作家。

sentences.english: This tune is a representative piece of Hebei folk instrumental music.
sentences.chinese: 此曲是河北民間器樂曲中具有代表性的作品之一。

sentences.english: Dangerous rock is a main geological hazard in the reservoir area of the Three Gorges Project, especially in Wanzhou area.
sentences.chinese: 三峽庫區危巖災害極其發育，萬州地區具有代表性。

sentences.english: The liquid-phase sample injection valve ensured the sampling reproducibility.
sentences.chinese: 使用液相進樣閥液態直接進樣保證了試樣的代表性。

sentences.english: We want to be the most representative way possible, To try.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望成爲最有代表性的可行之道，進行嘗試。

sentences.english: "Balance Theory" is one of Boharlin's representative works.
sentences.chinese: “平衡論”是布哈林的代表性理論之一。

sentences.english: Pan Yue was one of the most important representative writers in the Western Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 潘岳是西晉文壇上具有代表性的作家。

sentences.english: The rock fragments selected shall be real and representative; interference by fake rock fragments shall be eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 挑取的岩屑要真實具有代表性，排除假岩屑的干擾。

sentences.english: The global representativeness and enforcement capabilities of these institutions need to be further strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 這些機構的全球代表性和執行能力需要進一步加強。

sentences.english: Basic well pattern in eastern Nan2 area, Saertu Oilfield is the typical one.
sentences.chinese: 薩爾圖油田南二區東部基礎井網具有較好的代表性。

sentences.english: Lou Shenyi is a representative example of Chinese contemporary youth artists. He loves online games, animated cartoons, toys collecting, etc.
sentences.chinese: 婁申義在中國當代年輕藝術家中是極具代表性的一位。

sentences.english: Is the representative of shanxi opera, one of the big bang for Shanxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 是山西省的代表性劇種，爲山西省的四大梆子之一。

definition: one of (sth)/one out of a multitude/one (third, quarter, percent etc)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
prominent/outstanding/to give prominence to/to protrude/to project
